t: I*pn will not keep silent because of Zion, and*ln I will not keep still because of Jerusalem, until*ln her righteousness shines like a bright light and*ln her salvation, like a flaming torch.
Nations*pn will see your righteousness and*ln all kings, your glory. You*ln will be given a new name that*ln the Lord’s*s mouth will announce.
You*pn will be a glorious crown in the Lord’s*s hand, and*ln a royal diadem in the palm of your God’s hand.

You*ln will no longer be called Deserted, and*ln your land will not be called Desolate; instead,*ln you will be called My Delight Is in Her, and*ln your land Married; for*ln the Lord*s delights in you, and*ln your land will be married.
For*ln as a young man marries a young woman, so*ln your sons will marry you; and*ln as a groom rejoices over his bride, so*ln your God will rejoice over you.
Jerusalem,*ln I*ln have appointed watchmen on your walls; they*ln will never be silent, day or night. There*ln is no rest for you, who*ln remind the Lord.*s
Do*ln not give him rest until*ln he establishes and makes Jerusalem the*ln praise of the earth.

The*pn Lord*s has sworn with his right hand and*ln his strong arm: I*ln will no longer give your grain to*ln your enemies for food, and*ln foreigners will not drink the new wine for*ln which you have labored.
For*ln those who gather grain will eat it and*ln praise the Lord,*s and*ln those who harvest the grapes will drink the wine in*ln my holy courts.
Go*ln out, go out through the city gates; prepare*ln a way for the people! Build*ln it up, build up the highway; clear*ln away the stones! Raise*ln a banner for the peoples.
Look,*ln the Lord*s has proclaimed to*ln the ends of the earth, “Say*ln to Daughter Zion: Look,*ln your salvation is coming, his*ln wages are with him, and*ln his reward accompanies him.”
And*ln they will be called the Holy People, the*ln Lord’s*s Redeemed; and*ln you will be called Cared For, A*ln City Not Deserted.
